result.execSummary:
The defendant Hayley L. Carlson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV

Case called at 1:37pm [mo]
Defendant Hayley L. Carlson in court with Attorney Whitney Hagemann.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Counts #2 and #3
Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

--Anger Management Counseling or Batterers' Intervention programming, as deemed appropriate per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--No Contact with Caitlyn Dekarske
--no possession of any dangerous weapon 
--no acts or threats of violence
--pay all statutory costs, to include domestic abuse surcharge
--provide DNA sample

Days credit for time already served:  1  day
recess:1:51pm
Status conference on April 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Pre-trial conference on April 6, 2016 at 10:20 am.
Bond signed on 3-8-16 and received by COC on 3-9-16

ADDRESS INFO for Hayley L. Carlson
Current: c/o Lueder Haus, N4023 Annex Rd, Jefferson, WI 53549 United States  (Effective: 03-08-2016)
Prior: 421 Clover Lane, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538

Case called at 1:19 pm [sf]
Defendant Hayley L. Carlson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Whitney Hagemann from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office (PD will appoint counsel). Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Address and DOB information verified by the Court.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, maximum penalties recited
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant or Speedy Trial Demand by Defense.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $1,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence 
-No contact with Caitlyn Dekarske
-No presence at Abilities Group Home located at 421 Clover Lane in Fort Atkinson

Attorney Hagemann advises that the defendant will be going to the Leider House, does not know the address.
Court orders that all notices go to the Leider House.

Recess: 1:23 pm
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference scheduled for 4/6/16 at 10:20 am  - send notices  (2) Status Conference scheduled for 4/29/16 at 1:15 pm  - send notices
